definition: Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
man
martial/military
surname Wu
emperor

sentences.english: Yuan Ding five years, Emperor Li westbound parade to the Dazu County, and the temporary return of the Yellow River.
sentences.chinese: 元鼎五年，漢武帝西行巡遊到達祖厲縣，臨黃河而返。

sentences.english: Pleasant with the good news, Emperor Wu promoted Chen as a reward.
sentences.chinese: 漢武帝很高興，就提拔陳步樂爲郎官。

sentences.english: As a great intelligent and capable emperor, Han Wudi had made many more achievements than mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 漢武帝一生雄才大略，他的功績遠遠大於他的過失。

sentences.english: Anxious to find a way to save his city, the emperor asked Dongfang Shuo what he should do.
sentences.chinese: 爲了拯救長安城，漢武帝問東方朔該怎麼辦。

sentences.english: Part ii , the animadversion to Hanwu emperor's regnant policy at Salt-iron conference .
sentences.chinese: 鹽鐵會議對漢武帝內外統治政策的批判。

sentences.english: Minyue culture is the culture formed by the people in Minyue from the Spring and Autumn Period to the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 閩越文化即春秋戰國至漢武帝時期閩越人創造的文化。

sentences.english: Since the Han Dynasty began, the vertical Yubei 16 buildings.
sentences.chinese: 自漢武帝始，歷代立御碑16幢。

sentences.english: Of course, Emperor Wudi could see that Ji An was complaining.
sentences.chinese: 漢武帝當然聽得出這是發牢騷。

definition: the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
Han Dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Eastern or later Han dynasty, 25-220
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
unification (of the nation)/large scale unification
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
to write down/to record/written account
Jia Yi (200-168 BC), Chinese poet and statesman of the Western Han Dynasty
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
etiquette/system of rites
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
centralized state power
